title: Drugs and Society (13th Ed)(gnv64)
description: Drugs and Society (13th Ed) by Glen R. Hanson, Peter J. Venturelli & Annette E. Fleckenstein Jones & Bartlett Learning | February 2017 | ISBN-10: 1284110877 | True PDF | 694 page | 166 mb Revised to keep pace with the latest data and statistics, Drugs and Society, Thirteenth Edition with Navigate 2 Advantage Access, continues to captivate students by taking a multidisciplinary approach to the impact of drug use and abuse on the lives of average individuals. The authors have integrated their expertise in the fields of drug abuse, pharmacology, and sociology with their extensive experiences in research, treatment, drug policy making, and drug policy implementation to create an edition that speaks directly to students on the medical, emotional, and social damage drug use can cause. About the Authors Dr. Glen R. Hanson is the associate dean of the School of Dentistry, and a professor in the School of Dentistry and Department of Pharmacology and Toxicology at the University of Utah. Dr. Peter J. Venturelli has been the coauthor of this text since the second edition of Drugs and Society in 1988. Dr. Annette E. Fleckenstein has been a coauthor of Drugs and Society since its seventh edition and is a professor in the School of Dentistry at the University of Utah.
